techmeme.title: Sources: an Xbox-branded Asus handheld may debut this year as part of Microsoft's effort to unify Windows and Xbox into a universal library of Xbox and PC games (Tom Warren/The Verge)
Snapchat introduces AI video Lenses, powered by Snap's in-house generative video model, available to subscribers of the $16/month Snapchat Platinum tier (Aisha Malik/TechCrunch)
The US FTC asks a judge to delay its case accusing Amazon of deceptive practices with Amazon Prime, citing staffing shortfalls (Annie Palmer/CNBC)
Investigation: AI-powered student monitoring tool Gaggle, used to track ~6M US students, isn't always secure, and there's no research showing it boosts safety (Associated Press)
Google DeepMind launches two AI models, Gemini 2.0-based Robotics and Robotics-ER, to help robots "perform a wider range of real-world tasks than ever before" (Emma Roth/The Verge)
